title: Road Scholar: Treasures of the Art Institute of Chicago
description:
Program duration: April 30–May 5

Immerse yourself in the Art Institute of Chicago's world-renowned collection and the history of Chicago's artistic founders at the historic Palmer House Hilton. The Art Institute of Chicago has been a leading art school and museum for almost 130 years, amassing a collection spanning 5,000 years of human expression. Learn from expert curatorial staff and a professional team of Museum Education art historians as they guide you through gallery walks, slide lectures, and discussions. Examine ideas, techniques, and achievements from Ancient Egypt to modern America and explore the treasures of the Art Institute of Chicago.

>The full program includes a five-night stay downtown at the Palmer House Hilton Hotel just steps from the museum, daily museum admission, private tours with the experts, admission to special exhibitions, and all meals catered with one dinner on your own to explore Chicago's many excellent restaurants.Please contact Road Scholar for pricing and registration. To enroll, click on the button below or call (800) 454-5768.

Can't come this week? Road Scholar runs year-round at the Art Institute. Explore more opportunities.
